sentence: Shares of RH were jumping in premarket trading Thursday, following the Restoration Hardware parent’s upbeat fiscal second quarter.
The results have earned the shares at least one upgrade already.
After Wednesday’s close, RH (ticker: RH) said it earned $4.90 a share on revenue of $709.7 million, both of which beat consensus estimates.
It said its free cash flow doubled, margins expanded, and demand improved month over month through the quarter.
That was enough to get Telsey Advisory Group analyst Cristina Fernández to upgrade the stock on Thursday to Outperform from Market Perform, and raise her price target to $450 from $345.

She highlighted the better-than-expected demand that RH is seeing, evidence that “the high-income consumer is healthy and is investing in their homes,” and the company’s higher margins, which reflect the fact that “RH has elevated its product offering and pricing.”

That confidence led her to boost her full-year earnings estimates for this year and next by 38% and 31%, respectively.

Fernández is also upbeat about the company’s transformation “into an international luxury home lifestyle brand from a U.S. home furnishings retailer.” She believes RH can support this effort by improving its merchandise assortment, creating engaging brand-enhancing investments like its New York hotel, and improving productivity at its galleries.

All of those initiatives should help the stock, and she notes that other high-performing consumer companies, including Lululemon Athletica (LULU) and Estee Lauder (EL), generate operating margins around RH’s 20% target this year, with average price-to-earnings multiples of 35 times.
RH would need to trade at 23 times her new 2021 EPS estimate of $19.58 to reach her target price.
RH stock was up 20% to $385.50 near 9 a.m. Eastern time and is up more than 50% in 2020.
Dow Jones Industrial Average futures were up 0.2%.
Shares of furnishings seller Williams-Sonoma (WSM) were also higher following the report.
The retailer delivered a much higher profit than expected when it reported last month.
In addition, home improvement giants Home Depot (HD) and Lowe’s (LOW) have delivered great quarters this season.
